body_html:
I had a similar issue but found that removing...

device_filters=["/job:ps", "/job:worker/task:%d" % args.task_index],

... from my session configuration fixed it in my case. task_index refers to the worker 0/1/2/3 as in the example given at https://www.tensorflow.org/deploy/distributed, and 0 is treated as the chief.
body_text:
I had a similar issue but found that removing...
device_filters=["/job:ps", "/job:worker/task:%d" % args.task_index],

... from my session configuration fixed it in my case.  task_index refers to the worker 0/1/2/3 as in the example given at https://www.tensorflow.org/deploy/distributed, and 0 is treated as the chief.
body:
I had a similar issue but found that removing...

    device_filters=["/job:ps", "/job:worker/task:%d" % args.task_index],

... from my session configuration fixed it in my case.  `task_index` refers to the worker 0/1/2/3 as in the example given at https://www.tensorflow.org/deploy/distributed, and 0 is treated as the chief.
